creator: kate@rapidmoney.com
text:
NullPointerException is thrown after any JDBC request that doesn't
produce a result set.  This is due to code in JDBCSampler that attempts
to print out a variable that is initialized only if there is result set
(i.e. SELECT).

I am attaching a diff that fixes this.

NOTE: Aside from this problem, JDBC appears to work well in JMeter 1.7.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text:
Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
